channel.title: Deobing for a Beginner
channel.description:
anyone got any tips on things to do with a deob?
iv already done things like changed "Walk Here" to "Dont Walk Here" and public chat:"On" to public chat:"Speak Now"
iv tried doing the hp above heads tutorial on rs-resources, however, the client seems to have changed enough that it doesnt work
perhaps anyone has a link to a tutorial about deobing?

[quote=“Taios, post:9, topic:65367”]Or even better.

www.rs-resources.com/Highly%20Renamed%20Rs%20Deob.rar[/quote]<3 Thanks Taios! lol, might notta been for me, but I’ve been wanting a highly renamed one for a while

item.title: Deobing for a Beginner
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Ollie:

edit: ontopic, just find an old deob (like aryan) and see if u can find anything similar looking and just print it.

That’s actually really good advice. The basic structure of the client hasn’t changed that much. If you’re familiar with how the game works, then you can find important structures even in the “new” client with heavier obfuscation. People who have been cheating long enough to remember the client when it was easier to understand (or to have watched it develop) have a definite advantage.

Second piece of advice - get an IDE with a good “rename” refactoring feature.
IDEA is my favorite but Eclipse is free.
Go through the client renaming things as you figure out what they do (Aryan can help get you started). The more stuff you have renamed, the easier it is to figure out what other things do. Eventually you’ll build up a good idea of how the client runs and how to spot particular functions.

Hope it helps -
Aryan output for #365

Read full topic

item.title: Deobing for a Beginner
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Taios:

Which actually means the same thing basically. Their obfuscation is just to throw you off.

*its the deobfuscator not handling the xor properly!
Blame the deobfuscator!!!

but if you translate if ((i_5_ ^ 0xffffffff) < -31)
it actually equals i_5_ > 30

you can work it out by

chaning the sign and minus one

edit: ontopic, just find an old deob (like aryan) and see if u can find anything similar looking and just print it.

Read full topic

item.title: Deobing for a Beginner
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:5, topic:65367”]ah great! thumps up

one last question though, how did you know?
is it from experiance? or did you know in which class it was in?[/quote]

General experience :). You wont know what class it is in before you see the deob. (Or you have writen an updater or something like that to tell you)

The > 30 thing hasn’t changed, not even in the last rs engine, so i thus knew it was unlikely it had :p.

If (for future reference) > 30 doesnt give you the results. Search * 30, or < -31

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman

item.title: Deobing for a Beginner
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

Jagex’s obfuscation have changed it around so its not

something > 30

Its

if ((i_5_ ^ 0xffffffff) < -31)

Which actually means the same thing basically. Their obfuscation is just to throw you off.

int i_5_ = (class9_sub13_sub7_sub7.anInt3461 * 30 / class9_sub13_sub7_sub7.anInt3475); if ((i_5_ ^ 0xffffffff) < -31) i_5_ = 30;

Read full topic

item.title: Deobing for a Beginner
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

i think it has changed more than you think, the tutorial says
'look for this sort of thing about the line “> 30”
int i_9_ = (30 * class39_sub5_sub11_sub3.anInt2913 / class39_sub5_sub11_sub3.anInt2918);

however the deob i have has this

i_42_ = ((Class9_Sub13_Sub7_Sub2)
class9_sub13_sub7).method331() / 4;

that cant be right, because the int below should be the maximum hp,
iv searched in that file and the only other time the ‘/’ comes up is ‘((i - 63) / 62);’ which is probably irrelevant (and the part which says ‘decompiled by jode’)

would you be so helpful as to post a source?

Read full topic

item.title: Deobing for a Beginner
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

;). Last time i checked it hasn’t changed that much. If you like and the deobber i has decides to work. I’ll quickly do it for you and give you the source.

Also check out action id’s, things like that. You can then learn for example how jagex execute attack npc commands and make your own :).

Read full topic
